comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I find most of these women in a list of names in the February 1914 Congressional Directory at books.google.com/books?id=mLw-AAAAYAAJ&pg=PA289&l... "THE CONGRESSIONAL CLUB 1432 K Street Phone Main 7400 Incorporated by act of Congress approved May 30 1908 Membership composed of women in official life President Mrs Duncan U Fletcher Vice presidents Mrs Frank H Briggs Mrs Henry A Cooper Mrs Thomas P Gore Mrs James T Lloyd Mrs Lemuel P Padgett Recording secretary Mrs Horace M Towner Corresponding secretary Mrs John E Raker Treasurer Mrs Fred Dennett" So this is a collection of wives of senators and congressmen, perhaps even a picture of the club's officers. Although the word Ladies does not appear in the directory, the club seem's often to be known as the Ladies Congressional Club of Washington DC

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Yes, here's a use of the picture. The Washington times., February 18, 1915, HOME EDITION, Page 6 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1915-02-18/ed-... Congressional Club Playing Important Part in Lives of Official Women in Washington -- Organization, Now Occupying New Home at Sixteenth Street and New Hampshire Avenue, Is Distinct, Having Been Formed Under Special Act of Congress.
